intro: Scleranthus longirameus, commonly known as the long-stemmed sand rocket, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its triangular stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture, and it produces yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Scleranthus longirameus is adapted to arid environments and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
